titleStmt.title: Recto of a papyrus fragment with line ends of Ilias 8

availability.p: © Digital Corpus of Literary Papyri. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License .

encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

revisionDesc.change: Finalized - This is good to go.
Finalized - This is good to go.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - This is really well done. META: delete page numbers from biblio 53779 (they’re in the biblio entry already); add CWKB numbers for Homer (927) and Iliad (2815); update passage info 8.3-17. TEXT: remove r/v document division (and specify recto in the metadata); let’s go with vestig.1lin for line 4 (there are traces, according to the editor); dot the final epsilon in l. 11.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - This is really well done. META: delete page numbers from biblio 53779 (they’re in the biblio entry already); add CWKB numbers for Homer (927) and Iliad (2815); update passage info 8.3-17. TEXT: remove r/v document division (and specify recto in the metadata); let’s go with vestig.1lin for line 4 (there are traces, according to the editor); dot the final epsilon in l. 11.
Submit - Transcription entered from BKT edition as part of Heidelberg’s Digital Papyrology Webinar, summer 2020
Submit - Transcription entered from BKT edition as part of Heidelberg’s Digital Papyrology Webinar, summer 2020

Vote - Return-Straight-to-Sender - Please transcribe the text before submitting. For metadata, you might also look to update a few items: the editio princeps by Korzia-Panteli should be entered in the bibliography as a 'previous' edition; add a descriptive title under 'display name' (and delete 'legacy title'); and encode the passage details Il. 8.3-17 (via the 'add' button below 'Passage')
